messages.messageBody:
On 06:01 AM 8/7/04, samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com said...
>I was wondering if anyone here could recommend some books on samurai history.

You bet. Here's a list of books we used as reference for our Sengoku book:

http://www.sengoku.com/bibl.html


Mark Arsenault
Sengoku List Taisho

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] book recommendations
messages.msgSnippet: ... Where to begin? I d start with www.samurai-archives.com, and go to the recommended reading page. All the books I d recommend off the top of my head are
messages.messageBody:
--- ascal_elessar <ascal_elessar@...> wrote:

> I was wondering if anyone here could recommend some
> books on samurai
> history. I've only just developed an interest in
> this subject and am
> looking for a book which can give my a general
> background. Are there
> any particular books or authors that you would
> recommend?
>
> Thank you, in advance, for your help.

Where to begin? I'd start with
www.samurai-archives.com, and go to the recommended
reading page. All the books I'd recommend off the top
of my head are there, plus a lot more.

messages.subject: book recommendations
messages.msgSnippet: I was wondering if anyone here could recommend some books on samurai history. I ve only just developed an interest in this subject and am looking for a book
messages.messageBody:
I was wondering if anyone here could recommend some books on samurai
history. I've only just developed an interest in this subject and am
looking for a book which can give my a general background. Are there
any particular books or authors that you would recommend?

Thank you, in advance, for your help.
